rComments: Dropped his class before it even started. Talked to two students (one undergrad and one grad) who had taken his course. That was enough. You need to regurgitate his opinions to pass. Has certain opinions which are rather discriminatory of minorities, religion, and indigenous populations.

Gross is most definitely the kindest prof you'll have who cares for his students, and genuinely wants everyone to do well in his courses. He was even willing to sit down and chat with me about the future of my undergrad. His theories are remarkable and ground breaking, definitely looking forward to taking EEB465 to learn more about ABS.

Professor Gross is undoubtedly the best professor I have had the honour to study under for my first year in university. He is incredibly kind, and genuinely cares for all his students. All of his feedback is amazingly extensive, and will sit down with you after presentations to discuss your grade. Very fair grader, but lots of group work!
teacherRatingTags: ['Group projects', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Professor does care about students, but what he says is definitive. A lot of the materials could have different opinions but he sways heavily on the ideas he came up with (Advance Biology Science). Prof talks a lot about his accomplishments and his work during lectures.

Seminar Class. LOVED  it. Prof Gross: engaging, inspires you explore the material in a variety of ways, challenges you to get out of your comfort zone and think outside of the box. I walked out of the class with a different outlook on some controversial topics. Reading material: 2 books by Harari which explore our history & future. NO final exam

Great professor. He has a very deep understanding of the content, really cares for his students, and provides essential critical feedback. He challenged his students in this seminar a little more than I expected but if you like science you will enjoy the challenge that he brings to your table.

He taught a first-year seminar course about Human Ecology and Evolution this year. Had so many amazing and interesting things to say and is super passionate about what he taught. He's super friendly and really cares about his students, and he gave meaningful feedback on group presentations/papers. He is the reason I'm doing a Biology minor!

Prof. Gross taught me a lot about how to use my passions to achieve what I'm working for. He will probably hurt your feelings if you're the sensitive type. Overall great guy once you get past the harshness of his ideas. He was there to support me and genuinely cared about how I was doing.
Loved his lectures, tests were fair and information was very interesting and applicable
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: A great prof. He's very expressive about his anti-religious opinions, but besides that is a great prof and EEB255 is a great course. There's a lot of reading, but they're very interesting. Despite being a non-science student I loved this course and I would definitely recommend this class to everyone!
he is excellent for undergrad students, but his graduate students rarely graduate, and often transfer away from his lab. Be warned, don't take him a a grad supervisor!

The material in the course is quite interesting, but really easy and simple.  Prof. Gross seemed a bit insensitive to religious students (not me, but my friend dropped it after he called religious people several names.)  Easy course, sour/rude prof.

One of the best professor's i have had. Very fair prof and he cares about his students doing well. He made the course interesting so if anyone is in biology make sure you take this course or any course with prof gross.
another convocation hall lecture....
good guy, cares about the subject, deeply. good inspirator!
Absolute sweetheart, great teacher, great activist, and great academic/scientist. Very committed to conservation, beams with the idealism of a kid. It's  hard not to catch the enthusiasm.

It was an inspirational course, and I loved it all. He is no longer on the COSEWIC commitee, so may be he has more time to spend with us, compared to the last few comments, because I felt that he really cared about us 'students' this semester. I would take every class he taught if I could, unfortunately I found out too late about how amazing he is
No Comments
A great class with great content, but gross just does not give a damn about students. His chair position is what counts to him, and his teaching is a distant second
I loved this course.  Gross is inpirational and anyone interested in canadian biology and/or conservation should take all his courses.

This guy kept talking about how important he is and all the committees that he leads.  He didn't know what he was talking about.  He seems to hate students too and wasn't willing to answer any of my questions
